oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Nashville Then and Now, 1780-1930 by Maude Weidner, Hermitage Publishing Company, 1930
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: “Nashville Then and Now, 1780-1930,” by Maude Weidner (Mrs. Maude Weidner Jessen) was published in Nashville, Hermitage Publishing Co., 1930. This pamphlet provides a selection of significant phases of the history of Nashville, the development of the city spanning 1780-1930. The subject areas are: The Spirit of the pioneer--Such was the beginning--The good boat Adventure--Before the settlers came--Nashboro--The Cumberland Compact--Nashboro and Davidson County--The Courthouse--First mill--First road laid off--Difficulties in early life, Indian invasions--The darkest clouds--Romance of roadways--The settlement grows--The Natchez Trace--Contemporary records of early Nashville--The art of living--The colleges and universities--The public schools--After the school came the library--The romance of the printed page: newspapers--Nashville printing center of South--Nashville as an historic community--Indian battle sites--First marriage here--Original land grant--When Tennessee was part of North Carolina--Lasting as the pyramids--Battlefield of Nashville markers--The Maxwell House--The State Capitol--The Parthenon--The Hermitage, shrine of the Nation--Nashville as an economic center: transportation--Commercial activity as it was--Work of the civic clubs--A glimpse of Nashville yesterday, dramatic episodes--The ‘Why’ of the “Athens of the South”--Nashville, 1780-1930--And tomorrow?--What do we know about your eyes?--The Southern school of printing--Through the ages, cleanliness has chartered the path of Civilization--A famous dessert of a famous hostess--The romance of the fresh milk industry. This pamphlet consists of 85 pages, illustrations, portraits, and advertising included in the paging. The business advertisements include, but are not limited to: Nashville Bridge Company, Burrus Filling Station, Ambrose Printing Company, Methodist Publishing House, Vanderbilt University School of Nursing, Scarritt College for Christian Workers, National Life and Accident Insurance Company, Ward-Belmont, Holsum Bread, Sterchi Bros. Stores, Inc., Nashville Gas & Heating Company, Union Ice Cream, Upchurch Mattress Company, Period Furniture Company, Superior Baking Company, Tennessee College for Women, Betty-Lou Bread and Cake, Jacobs Packing Company, Nashville Pure Milk Company, Dixie Life & Accident Insurance Company, Ira Lamb & Sons, Antrim’s Ice Cream, American Dry Cleaners Tasty Potato Chips, Taylor Roofing Company, Edward Rehorn & Son, Mrs. A. Letty Funeral Home, Woodlawn Memorial Park, Nashville Automobile Club, Winn & Campion Grocery Co., Mount Olivet Cemetery, Bradford’s Furniture, Shield Life Insurance, Fisk University, Jersey Farms Milk Service, Green Vale Milk Company, Fred B. Cassetty Coal Co., Life & Casualty Insurance Co., Julius Jacob “A Department Store,” Wiles Commercial Photographers, Smotherman Drug. Co., Hermitage Printing Co., Baptist Sunday School Board, Marshall & Bruce Co., Tennessee Products Corporation, and Keith Hardware Stores. Forms part of the James H. Kilgore Collection-Publications. 1 pamphlet.
